inits_guide.Title: EXOTIC's Initialization File
inits_guide.Comment: Please answer all the following requirements below by following the format of the given
inits_guide.Comment1: sample dataset HAT-P-32 b. Edit this file as needed to match the data wanting to be reduced.
inits_guide.Comment2: Do not delete areas where there are quotation marks, commas, and brackets.
inits_guide.Comment3: The inits_guide dictionary (these lines of text) does not have to be edited
inits_guide.Comment4: and is only here to serve as a guide. Will be updated per user's advice.
inits_guide.Image Calibrations Directory Guide: Enter in the path to image calibrations or enter in null for none.
inits_guide.Planetary Parameters Guide: For planetary parameters that are not filled in, enter in null.
inits_guide.Comparison Star(s) Guide: Up to 10 comparison stars can be added following the format given below.
inits_guide.Obs. Latitude Guide: Indicate the sign (+ North, - South) before the degrees. Needs to be in decimal or HH:MM:SS format.
inits_guide.Obs. Longitude Guide: Indicate the sign (+ East, - West) before the degrees. Needs to be in decimal or HH:MM:SS format.
inits_guide.Camera Type (1): If you are using a CMOS, please enter CCD in 'Camera Type (CCD or DSLR)' and then note
inits_guide.Camera Type (2): your actual camera type under 'Observing Notes'.
inits_guide.Plate Solution: For your image to be given a plate solution, type y.
inits_guide.Plate Solution Disclaimer: One of your imaging files will be publicly viewable on nova.astrometry.net.
inits_guide.Standard Filter: To use EXOTIC standard filters, type only the filter name.
inits_guide.Custom Filter: To use a custom filter, enter in the FWHM in optional_info.
inits_guide.Target Star RA: Must be in HH:MM:SS sexagesimal format.
inits_guide.Target Star DEC: Must be in +/-DD:MM:SS sexagesimal format with correct sign at the beginning (+ or -).
inits_guide.Formatting of null: Due to the file being a .json, null is case sensitive and must be spelled as shown.
inits_guide.Decimal Format: Leading zero must be included when appropriate (Ex: 0.32, .32 or 00.32 causes errors.).
